quotes.quote: The intelligent man finds almost everything ridiculous, the sensible man hardly anything.

The most intelligent people disguise the fact that they are intelligent. Wise men do not  wear name tags. The more people talk about their own skills, the more desperate they are--their work should speak for itself.
A smart man makes a mistake, learns from it, and never makes that mistake again. But a wise man finds a smart man and learns from him how to avoid the mistake altogether.
A person who speaks cleverly is witty; one who asks questions is smart.
The Strong take from the weak, but the smart take from the strong.
You know what lasts longer than beauty? Being smart.
It's not about how smart you are. It's about your values.
Wherever smart people work, doors are unlocked.
Be smarter than other people, just don't tell them so.
A clever man commits no minor blunders.
Nobody is smart enough to be wrong all the time.
The smarter you get, the less you speak.
All clever men are birds of prey.
Alone we are smart. Together we are brilliant.
There is no great genius withou some touch of madness.
Half of being smart is knowing what you are dumb about.
The thing about smart people is that they seem like crazy people to dumb people.
Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
Being smarter than you look is better than looking smarter than you are.
No intelligent man has any respect for an unjust law.
Be as smart as you can, but remember that it is always better to be wise than to be smart.
The smart ones ask when they don't know. And, sometimes, when they do.
The intelligent man is one who has successfully fulfilled many accomplishments, and is yet willing to learn more.
It takes a smart guy to play dumb.
An intelligent man is sometimes forced to be drunk to spend time with his fools.
You can tell how smart people are by what they laugh at.
If you can't be seven feet tall, be seven feet smart.
The desire to be thought clever often prevents a man from becoming so.
The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
Action is the real measure of intelligence.
